channel.title: Engadget
channel.description: Engadget is a web magazine with obsessive daily coverage of everything new in gadgets and consumer electronics
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2021 Yahoo! Inc. All rights reserved

item.title: Xbox Series X and S owners start testing Dolby Vision HDR for gaming
item.description: Xbox Series X and S owners are reporting that Microsoft has started testing Dolby Vision HDR on the consoles, albeit with limits.

item.title: China reportedly bans Tesla cars from military facilities over spying fears
item.description: China's military has reportedly banned Tesla cars from its facilities over fears the cameras could be used for spying.

item.title: ICYMI: We spend a few nights with the Bose Sleepbuds 2
item.description: Here's a recap of Engadget's tech reviews from this week, including those for the Bose Sleepbuds 2 and AMD's Radeon RX 6700 XT GPU.

item.title: Hitting the Books: Bill Gates on why we can't have electric airplanes
item.description: In his new book, tech luminary Bill Gates lays out his comprehensive plan to halt the oncoming environmental apocalypse, blunt the effects of human-caused climate change, and keep Earth habitable for the next generation.

item.title: Get a 13-course training bundle on DIY PIC microcontrollers for $50
item.description: With 27 hours of expert instruction, this course bundle will teach you how to build remote door locks, RC vehicles and more.

item.title: Recommended Reading: Breaking down 'Zack Snyder’s Justice League'
item.description: Recommended Reading highlights the week's best long-form writing on technology and more.

item.title: The Morning After: A ransomware gang is demanding $50 million from Acer
item.description: Acer is reportedly suffering a ransomware attack, and we're taking a look at the future of Twitter.

item.title: 'United States vs. Reality Winner' is sympathetic, but not essential
item.description: 'United States vs. Reality Winner' is sympathetic whisteblower documentary that could go a lot deeper.

item.title: Acer reportedly hit by $50 million ransomware attack
item.description: The REvil ransomware gang is demanding $50 million from Taiwanese computer manufacturer Acer, according to Bleeping Computer, The Record and other sources, and it may have exploited a Microsoft Exchange vulnerability to gain entry into the company's network.

item.title: Tablo rolls out a $200 quad-tuner DVR with HDMI
item.description: This $200 DVR can record up to four programs at once on USB-connected storage.

item.title: Microsoft updated Windows 10 again to fix printer problems
item.description: An emergency Windows 10 update last week fixed BSOD errors linked to printers, and now a second one addresses missing graphics and logos.

item.title: Facebook may soon face a UK antitrust investigation
item.description: Regulators might look into whether Facebook harnessed user data to fend off rivals.

item.title: PAWS anti-poaching AI predicts where illegal hunters will show up next
item.description: AI and machine learning systems are poised to drastically improve wildlife rangers’ effectiveness by helping them not only track where poachers have been but also predict where they are most likely to turn up.

item.title: Legal questions linger as governments and companies keep pushing into space
item.description: The Perseverance rover’s landing on Mars is still fresh in people’s memories, privately-owned companies are ferrying people and supplies into orbit, and NASA continues to work on “the most powerful rocket” it has ever built. But as world governments and private enterprises continue to eye the skies for opportunities, a SXSW panel called “Who on Earth should govern Space” makes clear that the world’s laws dealing with space aren’t evolving as fast as the technology that gets us there.

item.title: Cyberpunk 2077's next big update will try to fix janky cops and cars
item.description: There's no exact release date for the 1.2 patch, but CDPR revealed more of what's in store.

item.title: Omaze is giving away $20,000 to build a dream PC
item.description: Enter to win $20,000 to build your dream PC at Omaze, with the proceeds going to Gamers Outreach.

item.title: Instagram and WhatsApp are back online after an outage this afternoon
item.description: Instagram and WhatsApp appear to be coming back online after going down for roughly an hour in an outage that affected multiple Facebook services.

item.title: Hulu’s WeWork documentary depicts the rise and fall of a cult
item.description: Hulu's WeWork documentary takes a look at the dramatic rise and fall of a company, but it can't get a handle on the enigma at the heart of its story.

item.title: 'Gotham Knights' Batman game delayed until 2022
item.description: WB Games Montreal's co-op RPG was supposed to arrive later this year.

item.title: The best deals we found this week: $40 off the Echo Show 5 and more
item.description: Here's a list of the best tech deals from this week, including a big sale on Amazon Echo devices and $150 off Apple's MacBook Pro M1.

item.title: Gamescom 2021 is planned as a hybrid in-person and virtual event
item.description: Gamescom 2021 is planned as a hybrid in-person and virtual event — although it's not guaranteed to go as planned given the pandemic.

item.title: OnePlus Watch revealed ahead of 9 Series event
item.description: The smartwatch has a circular face and at least two side buttons.

item.title: Take a look back at Engadget's favorite Game Boy Advance games
item.description: On the 20th anniversary of the Game Boy Advance, the Engadget staff looks back at some of its favorite GBA titles.

item.title: These portable monitors are top-rated on Amazon and just went on sale
item.description: Portable monitors that connect to laptops (or tablets, or even phones) exist, and they’re reliable and easy to use. We’ve collected some of the most well-reviewed on Amazon below, all of which are discounted between 10 and 15 percent.

item.title: Townbuilder's chill gameplay hits mobile and Switch this summer
item.description: The chill urban creation game 'Townscaper' is coming to mobile and Switch this summer after months of buzz on PC.
